added_lines: <?xml version="1.0" ?> <workflow createAction="init" deleteAction="teardown" name="l4" xmlns="http://www.radware.com/vdirect"> <description>Base L4 Workflow for vDirect Plugin for vCNS [2013-06-17 05:30:41.269852]</description> <persist> <parameters> <!-- The vDirect Service --> <parameter name="service" prompt="Radware vDirect ADC Service" type="adcService"/> <!-- "Base" parameters --> <!--parameter name="virtServerName" prompt="Name for Virtual Server" type="string"/--> <parameter name="vip" prompt="VIP Address" type="ip"/> <parameter defaultValue="true" name="virtServerEnabled" prompt="Should the Virtual Server be enabled?" type="bool"/> <parameter defaultValue="false" name="virtSvcHttpEnabled" prompt="Is HTTP Enabled?" type="bool"/> <parameter defaultValue="80" name="virtSvcHttpPort" prompt="HTTP Virtual Service Port" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="none" name="virtSvcHttpPersistMethod" prompt="HTTP Virtual Service Persistence Method" type="string" values="none,COOKIE"/> <parameter defaultValue="none" name="virtSvcHttpCookieMode" prompt="HTTP Virtual Service Cookie Mode" type="string" values="none,INSERT,PREFIX,APP"/> <parameter defaultValue="none" name="virtSvcHttpCookieName" prompt="HTTP Virtual Service Cookie Name" type="string"/> <parameter defaultValue="false" name="virtSvcHttpsEnabled" prompt="Is HTTPS Enabled?" type="bool"/> <parameter defaultValue="443" name="virtSvcHttpsPort" prompt="HTTPS Virtual Service Port" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="none" name="virtSvcHttpsPersistMethod" prompt="HTTPS Virtual Service Persistence Method" type="string" values="none,SSL_SESSION_ID"/> <parameter defaultValue="false" name="virtSvcTcpEnabled" prompt="Is TCP Enabled?" type="bool"/> <parameter defaultValue="0" name="virtSvcTcpPort" prompt="TCP Virtual Service Port (0 means no value)" type="int"/> <!--parameter name="poolName" prompt="Name of the Real Server Group" type="string"/--> <!--parameter name="svcPortHttpEnabled" type="bool" prompt="Is HTTP Enabled?" ="true"/--> <parameter defaultValue="ROUND_ROBIN" name="svcPortHttpAlgorithm" prompt="HTTP Load Balancing Metric" type="string" values="IP_HASH,ROUND_ROBIN,URI,LEAST_CONN"/> <parameter defaultValue="80" name="svcPortHttpPort" prompt="HTTP Load Balancing Port" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="HTTP" name="svcPortHttpHealthMode" prompt="HTTP Healthcheck Type" type="string" values="PING,HTTP,HTTPS,TCP"/> <parameter defaultValue="5" name="svcPortHttpHealthInterval" prompt="HTTP Healthcheck Interval" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="15" name="svcPortHttpHealthTimeout" prompt="HTTP Healthcheck Timeout" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="2" name="svcPortHttpHealthThresh" prompt="HTTP Good Healthcheck Threshold" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="3" name="svcPortHttpUnHealthThresh" prompt="HTTP Bad Healthcheck Threshold" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="0" name="svcPortHttpHealthPort" prompt="HTTP Healthcheck Port (0 means no value)" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="/" name="svcPortHttpHealthUri" prompt="HTTP Healthcheck URL (none stands for no value)" type="string"/> <!--parameter name="svcPortHttpsEnabled" type="bool" prompt="Is HTTPS Enabled?" defaultValue="false"/--> <parameter defaultValue="ROUND_ROBIN" name="svcPortHttpsAlgorithm" prompt="HTTPS Load Balancing Metric" type="string" values="IP_HASH,ROUND_ROBIN,URI,LEAST_CONN"/> <parameter defaultValue="443" name="svcPortHttpsPort" prompt="HTTPS Load Balancing Port" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="SSL" name="svcPortHttpsHealthMode" prompt="HTTPS Healthcheck Type" type="string" values="SSL,TCP"/> <parameter defaultValue="5" name="svcPortHttpsHealthInterval" prompt="HTTPS Healthcheck Interval" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="15" name="svcPortHttpsHealthTimeout" prompt="HTTPS Healthcheck Timeout" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="2" name="svcPortHttpsHealthThresh" prompt="HTTPS Good Healthcheck Threshold" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="3" name="svcPortHttpsUnHealthThresh" prompt="HTTPS Bad Healthcheck Threshold" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="0" name="svcPortHttpsHealthPort" prompt="HTTPS Healthcheck Port (0 means no value)" type="int"/> <!--parameter name="svcPortTcpEnabled" type="bool" prompt="Is TCP Enabled?" defaultValue="false"/--> <parameter defaultValue="ROUND_ROBIN" name="svcPortTcpAlgorithm" prompt="TCP Load Balancing Metric" type="string" values="IP_HASH,ROUND_ROBIN,URI,LEAST_CONN"/> <parameter defaultValue="0" name="svcPortTcpPort" prompt="TCP Load Balancing Port (0 means no value)" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="TCP" name="svcPortTcpHealthMode" prompt="TCP Healthcheck Type" type="string" values="TCP"/> <parameter defaultValue="5" name="svcPortTcpHealthInterval" prompt="TCP Healthcheck Interval" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="15" name="svcPortTcpHealthTimeout" prompt="TCP Healthcheck Timeout" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="2" name="svcPortTcpHealthThresh" prompt="TCP Good Healthcheck Threshold" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="3" name="svcPortTcpUnHealthThresh" prompt="TCP Bad Healthcheck Threshold" type="int"/> <parameter defaultValue="0" name="svcPortTcpHealthPort" prompt="TCP Healthcheck Port (0 means no value)" type="int"/> <!-- NOTE: since vCNS allows the user to configure pool members individually, we have to use the following scheme to pass all of that information to this workflow. the following 8 arrays represent all the attributes of the real servers. so the first real server's configuration would be the contents of all 8 arrays' values at array index 0, the second real server would be at index 1, etc. --> <parameter name="memberIps" prompt="Real Server IPs" type="ip[]"/> <parameter max="256" min="1" name="memberWeights" prompt="Real Server Weights" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="memberHttpPorts" prompt="Real Server HTTP Ports (0 means no value)" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="memberHttpHealthPorts" prompt="Real Server HTTP Healthcheck Ports (0 means no value)" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="memberHttpsPorts" prompt="Real Server HTTPS Ports (0 means no value)" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="memberHttpsHealthPorts" prompt="Real Server HTTPS Healthcheck Ports (0 means no value)" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="memberTcpPorts" prompt="Real Server TCP Ports (0 means no value)" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="memberTcpHealthPorts" prompt="Real Server TCP Healthcheck Ports (0 means no value)" type="int[]"/> <parameter defaultValue="save" name="apply_type" prompt="Device apply type" type="string" values="none,apply,save"/> <!-- "Extended" parameters --> <!-- TODO: Add extended parameters --> <parameter name="pipAddress" prompt="Proxy IP Address (0.0.0.0 means no value)" type="ip"/> <!-- Calculated --> <parameter name="httpNeedNewValues" type="bool"/> <parameter name="httpsNeedNewValues" type="bool"/> <parameter name="tcpNeedNewValues" type="bool"/> <parameter name="httpVirtId1" type="int"/> <parameter name="httpGroupId1" type="int"/> <parameter name="httpNewValues1" type="bool"/> <parameter name="httpRealServerIds1" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="httpsVirtId1" type="int"/> <parameter name="httpsGroupId1" type="int"/> <parameter name="httpsNewValues1" type="bool"/> <parameter name="httpsRealServerIds1" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="tcpVirtId1" type="int"/> <parameter name="tcpGroupId1" type="int"/> <parameter name="tcpNewValues1" type="bool"/> <parameter name="tcpRealServerIds1" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="httpVirtId2" type="int"/> <parameter name="httpGroupId2" type="int"/> <parameter name="httpNewValues2" type="bool"/> <parameter name="httpRealServerIds2" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="httpsVirtId2" type="int"/> <parameter name="httpsGroupId2" type="int"/> <parameter name="httpsNewValues2" type="bool"/> <parameter name="httpsRealServerIds2" type="int[]"/> <parameter name="tcpVirtId2" type="int"/> <parameter name="tcpGroupId2" type="int"/> <parameter name="tcpNewValues2" type="bool"/> <parameter name="tcpRealServerIds2" type="int[]"/> <parameter defaultValue="none" name="currSvcPortHttpHealthMode" prompt="Current HTTP Healthcheck Type" type="string" values="none,HTTP,TCP"/> <parameter defaultValue="none" name="currSvcPortHttpsHealthMode" prompt="Current HTTPS Healthcheck Type" type="string" values="none,SSL,TCP"/> <parameter defaultValue="none" name="currSvcPortTcpHealthMode" prompt="Current TCP Healthcheck Type" type="string" values="none,TCP"/> <parameter defaultValue="http" name="httpVirtSvcType" prompt="HTTP Service Type" type="string" values="http"/> <parameter defaultValue="https" name="httpsVirtSvcType" prompt="HTTPS Service Type" type="string" values="https"/> <parameter defaultValue="tcp" name="tcpVirtSvcType" prompt="TCP Service Type" type="string" values="tcp"/> <parameter defaultValue="none" name="noneValue" prompt="Constant for none" type="string" values="none"/> </parameters> </persist> <states> <state name="initialized"/> <state name="baseapplied"/> <state name="extapplied"/> <state name="removed"/> </states> <actions> <action fromState="none" name="init" toState="initialized"> <inputs> <parameters> <parameter name="service"/> </parameters> </inputs> <sequence> <log message="This may take time... making sure that the service is provisioned."/> <script file="wait_for_service.groovy" name="wait_for_service"/> <log message="Service is provisioned."/> </sequence> <onError> <log message="Service is not ready!!"/> </onError> </action> <action fromState="initialized,baseapplied,extapplied" name="BaseCreate" toState="baseapplied"> <inputs> <parameters> <!--parameter name="virtServerName"/--> <parameter name="vip"/> <parameter name="virtServerEnabled"/> <parameter name="virtSvcHttpEnabled"/> <parameter name="virtSvcHttpPort"/> <parameter name="virtSvcHttpPersistMethod"/> <parameter name="virtSvcHttpCookieMode"/> <parameter name="virtSvcHttpCookieName"/> <parameter name="virtSvcHttpsEnabled"/> <parameter name="virtSvcHttpsPort"/> <parameter name="virtSvcHttpsPersistMethod"/> <parameter name="virtSvcTcpEnabled"/> <parameter name="virtSvcTcpPort"/> <!--parameter name="poolName"/--> <!--parameter name="svcPortHttpEnabled"/--> <parameter name="svcPortHttpAlgorithm"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpPort"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpHealthMode"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpHealthInterval"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpHealthTimeout"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpHealthThresh"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpUnHealthThresh"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpHealthPort"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpHealthUri"/> <!--parameter name="svcPortHttpsEnabled"/--> <parameter name="svcPortHttpsAlgorithm"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpsPort"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpsHealthMode"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpsHealthInterval"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpsHealthTimeout"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpsHealthThresh"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpsUnHealthThresh"/> <parameter name="svcPortHttpsHealthPort"/> <!--parameter name="svcPortTcpEnabled"/--> <parameter name="svcPortTcpAlgorithm"/> <parameter name="svcPortTcpPort"/> <parameter name="svcPortTcpHealthMode"/> <parameter name="svcPortTcpHealthInterval"/> <parameter name="svcPortTcpHealthTimeout"/> <parameter name="svcPortTcpHealthThresh"/> <parameter name="svcPortTcpUnHealthThresh"/> <parameter name="svcPortTcpHealthPort"/> <parameter name="memberIps"/> <parameter name="memberWeights"/> <parameter name="memberHttpPorts"/> <parameter name="memberHttpHealthPorts"/> <parameter name="memberHttpsPorts"/> <parameter name="memberHttpsHealthPorts"/> <parameter name="memberTcpPorts"/> <parameter name="memberTcpHealthPorts"/> </parameters> </inputs> <devices> <device device="$service.primary" name="adc1"/> <device device="$service.secondary" name="adc2"/> </devices> <sequence> <!--validateCleanDevice name="check"/--> <log message="This may take time... making sure that the service is provisioned."/> <script file="wait_for_service.groovy" name="wait_for_service"/> <log message="Service is provisioned."/> </sequence> <!--Handle the first time we run for all services--> <sequence ifState="initialized"> <set saveAs="$httpNeedNewValues" value="true"/> <set saveAs="$httpsNeedNewValues" value="true"/> <set saveAs="$tcpNeedNewValues" value="true"/> <set saveAs="$noneValue" value="'none'"/> <set saveAs="$httpVirtSvcType" value="'http'"/> <set saveAs="$currSvcPortHttpHealthMode" value="'none'"/> <set saveAs="$httpsVirtSvcType" value="'https'"/> <set saveAs="$currSvcPortHttpsHealthMode" value="'none'"/> <set saveAs="$tcpVirtSvcType" value="'tcp'"/> <set saveAs="$currSvcPortTcpHealthMode" value="'none'"/> <set saveAs="$httpRealServerIds1" value="[0]"/> <set saveAs="$httpsRealServerIds1" value="[0]"/> <set saveAs="$tcpRealServerIds1" value="[0]"/> <set saveAs="$httpRealServerIds2" value="[0]"/> <set saveAs="$httpsRealServerIds2" value="[0]"/> <set saveAs="$tcpRealServerIds2" value="[0]"/> </sequence> <!--Handle the need to allocated indexes for HTTP if not allocated--> <sequence if="$virtSvcHttpEnabled && $httpNeedNewValues"> <configuration file="init_indexes.vm" name="HTTP_init_indexes_adc1"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc1" to="$adc"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpPort" to="$virtSvcPort"/> <!-- Outputs --> <map from="$httpGroupId1" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$httpVirtId1" to="$virtId"/> <map from="$httpNewValues1" to="$newValues"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <error if="!$httpNewValues1" message="HTTP service on vip $vip and port $virtSvcHttpPort already exists on device $adc1!"/> <configuration file="init_indexes.vm" name="HTTP_init_indexes_adc2"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc2" to="$adc"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpPort" to="$virtSvcPort"/> <!-- Outputs --> <map from="$httpGroupId2" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$httpVirtId2" to="$virtId"/> <map from="$httpNewValues2" to="$newValues"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <error if="!$httpNewValues2" message="HTTP service on vip $vip and port $virtSvcHttpPort already exists on device $adc2!"/> <set saveAs="$httpNeedNewValues" value="false"/> </sequence> <!--Handle create and update of the HTTP service--> <sequence if="$virtSvcHttpEnabled"> <configuration file="manage_l4.vm" name="HTTP_manage_l4_adc1"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc1" to="$adc"/> <map from="$httpGroupId1" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$httpVirtId1" to="$virtId"/> <!--map from="$virtServerEnabled" to="$virtServerEnabled"/--> <!--map from="$vip" to="$vip"/--> <map from="$virtSvcHttpPort" to="$virtSvcPort"/> <map from="$httpVirtSvcType" to="$virtSvcType"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpAlgorithm" to="$svcPortAlgorithm"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpPersistMethod" to="$virtSvcPersistMethod"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpCookieMode" to="$virtSvcCookieMode"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpCookieName" to="$virtSvcCookieName"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <configuration file="manage_l4.vm" name="HTTP_manage_l4_adc2"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc2" to="$adc"/> <map from="$httpGroupId2" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$httpVirtId2" to="$virtId"/> <!--map from="$virtServerEnabled" to="$virtServerEnabled"/--> <!--map from="$vip" to="$vip"/--> <map from="$virtSvcHttpPort" to="$virtSvcPort"/> <map from="$httpVirtSvcType" to="$virtSvcType"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpAlgorithm" to="$svcPortAlgorithm"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpPersistMethod" to="$virtSvcPersistMethod"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpCookieMode" to="$virtSvcCookieMode"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpCookieName" to="$virtSvcCookieName"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <configuration file="manage_rips.vm" name="HTTP_manage_rips_adc1"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc1" to="$adc"/> <map from="$httpGroupId1" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpPort" to="$svcPort"/> <map from="$currSvcPortHttpHealthMode" to="$currSvcPortHealthMode"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthMode" to="$svcPortHealthMode"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthInterval" to="$svcPortHealthInterval"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthTimeout" to="$svcPortHealthTimeout"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthThresh" to="$svcPortHealthThresh"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpUnHealthThresh" to="$svcPortUnHealthThresh"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthPort" to="$svcPortHealthPort"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthUri" to="$svcPortHealthUri"/> <map from="$httpRealServerIds1" to="$curRealServerIds"/> <!--map from="$memberIps" to="$memberIps"/--> <!--map from="$memberWeights" to="$memberWeights"/--> <map from="$memberHttpPorts" to="$memberPorts"/> <map from="$memberHttpHealthPorts" to="$memberHealthPorts"/> <!--output parameters--> <map from="$httpRealServerIds1" to="$realServerIds"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <configuration file="manage_rips.vm" name="HTTP_manage_rips_adc2"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc2" to="$adc"/> <map from="$httpGroupId2" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpPort" to="$svcPort"/> <map from="$currSvcPortHttpHealthMode" to="$currSvcPortHealthMode"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthMode" to="$svcPortHealthMode"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthInterval" to="$svcPortHealthInterval"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthTimeout" to="$svcPortHealthTimeout"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthThresh" to="$svcPortHealthThresh"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpUnHealthThresh" to="$svcPortUnHealthThresh"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthPort" to="$svcPortHealthPort"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthUri" to="$svcPortHealthUri"/> <map from="$httpRealServerIds2" to="$curRealServerIds"/> <!--map from="$memberIps" to="$memberIps"/--> <!--map from="$memberWeights" to="$memberWeights"/--> <map from="$memberHttpPorts" to="$memberPorts"/> <map from="$memberHttpHealthPorts" to="$memberHealthPorts"/> <!--output parameters--> <map from="$httpRealServerIds2" to="$realServerIds"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <set saveAs="$currSvcPortHttpHealthMode" value="$svcPortHttpHealthMode"/> </sequence> <!--Handle the case ehere the HTTP service should be deleted because it was breviously enabled and now it is desabled--> <sequence if="!$virtSvcHttpEnabled && !$httpNeedNewValues"> <configuration file="teardown_l4_and_rips.vm" name="HTTP_teardown_rips_adc1"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc1" to="$adc"/> <map from="$httpVirtId1" to="$virtId"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthMode" to="$svcPortHealthMode"/> <map from="$httpGroupId1" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$httpRealServerIds1" to="$curRealServerIds"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <configuration file="teardown_l4_and_rips.vm" name="HTTP_teardown_rips_adc2"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc2" to="$adc"/> <map from="$httpVirtId2" to="$virtId"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpHealthMode" to="$svcPortHealthMode"/> <map from="$httpGroupId2" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$httpRealServerIds2" to="$curRealServerIds"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <set saveAs="$httpNeedNewValues" value="true"/> <set saveAs="$currSvcPortHttpHealthMode" value="'none'"/> <set saveAs="$httpVirtId1" value="0"/> <set saveAs="$httpGroupId1" value="0"/> <set saveAs="$httpRealServerIds1" value="[0]"/> <set saveAs="$httpVirtId2" value="0"/> <set saveAs="$httpGroupId2" value="0"/> <set saveAs="$httpRealServerIds2" value="[0]"/> </sequence> <!--Handle the need to allocated indexes for HTTPS if not allocated--> <sequence if="$virtSvcHttpsEnabled && $httpsNeedNewValues"> <configuration file="init_indexes.vm" name="HTTPS_init_indexes_adc1"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc1" to="$adc"/> <map from="$virtSvcHttpsPort" to="$virtSvcPort"/> <!-- Outputs --> <map from="$httpsGroupId1" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$httpsVirtId1" to="$virtId"/> service--> <sequence if="$virtSvcHttpsEnabled"> <configuration file="manage_l4.vm" name="HTTPS_manage_l4_adc1"> <parameterMapping> <map from="$adc1" to="$adc"/> <map from="$httpsGroupId1" to="$groupId"/> <map from="$httpsVirtId1" to="$virtId"/> <!--map from="$virtServerEnabled" to="$virtServerEnabled"/--> <!--map from="$vip" to="$vip"/--> <map from="$virtSvcHttpsPort" <map from="$noneValue" to="$virtSvcCookieMode"/> <map from="$noneValue" to="$virtSvcCookieName"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> <configuration file="manage_l4.vm" name="HTTPS_manage_l4_adc2"> to="$svcPort"/> <map from="$currSvcPortHttpsHealthMode" to="$currSvcPortHealthMode"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpsHealthMode" to="$svcPortHealthMode"/> <map from="$svcPortHttpsHealthInterval" to="$memberPorts"/> <map from="$memberHttpsHealthPorts" to="$memberHealthPorts"/> <!--output parameters--> <map from="$httpsRealServerIds1" to="$realServerIds"/> </parameterMapping> </configuration> commit_message:
Remove `utils.timefunc` function

This is not used anywhere.

Change-Id: I189d9e45a91df42726048942e908e39872435872
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/49182/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def timefunc(func): """Decorator that logs how long a particular function took to execute.""" @functools.wraps(func) def inner(*args, **kwargs): start_time = time.time() try: return func(*args, **kwargs) finally: total_time = time.time() - start_time LOG.debug(_("timefunc: '%(name)s' took %(total_time).2f secs") % dict(name=func.__name__, total_time=total_time)) return inner

subject: feat(api): Client-ID as a real UUID
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-02 14:37:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/2d49c6bd7aa197c7c266a548617c3b1226e29b0b', 'message': 'feat(api): Client-ID is now a real UUID

We store the UUID in binary form in DBs, and perform checking
on user inputs.

Change-Id: Ic3048a0d2aa21bd201e2d2d9cd8a562662cf8f8e
Closes-Bug: 1233420
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-02 14:45:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/6d7cd594e3a5108f42ad5b92f4cee9588875b9fc', 'message': 'feat(api): Client-ID is now a real UUID

on user inputs.

Change-Id: Ic3048a0d2aa21bd201e2d2d9cd8a562662cf8f8e
Closes-Bug: 1233420
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-10-02 17:21:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/34dfae9cfafb802f5d4ebcef30417ceed22204e9', 'message': 'feat(api): Client-ID is now a real UUID

We store the UUID in binary form in DBs, and perform checking
on user inputs.  Compared with the hex form we currently using,
the binary form saves half space to store.  In addition, by
enforcing UUID on the server side, we can minimize the chance of
client ID collision.

Closes-Bug: 1233420

commit_message:
feat(api): Client-ID as a real UUID

We store the UUID in binary form in DBs, and perform checking
on user inputs.  Compared with the hex form we currently using,
the binary form saves half space to store.  In addition, by
enforcing UUID on the server side, we can minimize the chance of
client ID collision.

Change-Id: Ic3048a0d2aa21bd201e2d2d9cd8a562662cf8f8e
Closes-Bug: 1233420

commit_message:
feat(api): give validation resp a different title

HTTPBadRequestBody should only be used to indicate the errors
with content body, while input validation errors should be
regarded as violations on API calling conventions.

Change-Id: I23990f58ff3233fe1cf4febad77efe0173027a33

commit_message:
MidoNet plugin, clean up dhcp entries correctly

When a subnet gets deleted, remove the proper dhcp entry, not
always the first one.

Change-Id: I4f152eed5a7dd408bda866cb304838989bdc363c
Solves-bug: #1233259

commit_message:
Add flag to make baremetal.pxe file injection optional

File injection is slow and risky, So make it optional. File injection
was used for getting networking configuration into the baremetal nodes,
but neutron can do this now. File injection is also used for general
file injection and password injection, but those should be optional as
well.

Change-Id: If59641952255e5aaf3767524e2b3c566eefe2b74
Related-Bug: #1178103

commit_message:
Swift store add should not use wildcard raise

When there is an yield block in an except clause prior to wildcard raise,
if the thread is re-scheduled, the raise generates a TypeError.
Since the caught exception has NoneType, it causes a wrong exception(NoneType)
to be raised.

Fixes bug #1226258

Change-Id: I6ce56d1943535279f2ad40c7978b1539ed638d57

commit_message:
Fix V3 API flavor returning empty string for attributes

Fixes cases where in the V3 API the ephemeral, swap and vcpus
attributes for flavors were returned as the empty string
when they had a value of 0. Also removes default setting for
the disabled attribute as it is always set in the db.

Fixes up some associated testcase data as it was using data which
could not exist in the db.

Change-Id: I90f48956411f792037b1cd744c4fa8d287f9e752
Closes-Bug: #1216929

commit_message:
Adds v3 API samples for hide server addresses and keypairs

Adds the v3 API samples for the hide server addresses and
keypairs extensions. Bundled together to reduce review load

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-specification

+DocImpact

Change-Id: If331d79a878af7543c8792ab4d675fc996c3cd04

commit_message:
Adds V3 API samples for srvcs, tenant usage, server_diagnostics

Adds V3 API samples for the services, simple tenant usage and
server_diagnostics extensions. Bundling them together to save
on review load

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests
Partially implements blueprint v3-api-specification

Change-Id: I91edc6500acbe92221427383b4bcd3d00a8faadd

commit_message:
Service Registration using conf file

Making the DB specific settings for Service
Registry configuration driven that will help
in addition/removal/modification dynamically
for new service type.

Format for adding new service type in guestagen
config file will be -
service_registry_ext  = <add service type in dictonary>

implements: blueprint configuration-driven-changes

Change-Id: I0fc1a80f0fa70dbc0c477e31b5374d156bb03488

commit_message:
Move call to _default_block_device_names() inside try block

During instance builds, a call to _default_block_device_names() is
made which contains a db call to update the instance. In case the
instance is gone it will throw an unhandled InstanceNotFound exception.

To properly handle this, move the call to _default_block_device_names()
inside the existing try block next to it that handles this exception.

Change-Id: I3503029f02669e6ae31441653096fa69cba76d45
Closes-Bug: #1224677

commit_message:
Overwrite passwords in devtest_*

If we don't use this flag, running devtest twice results in an unusable
cloud and a stalled build. Using --overwrite just makes sense for
iterating on devtest.

Change-Id: If1c4f73cd5cb1d2888505bf3d1eba855ee6b5a94

commit_message:
baremetal: Fix misuse of "instance" parameter of attach/detach_volume

Some parts of baremetal driver treat "instance" parameter as if it is
the name of an instance, but actually it is the instance itself (dict).

Closes-Bug: #1221244
Change-Id: I01a296a6ac0bbf7c5fec3434ddf1197828b849b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/45234/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: connection_info, instance, mountpoint) connection_info, instance, mountpoint) def detach_volume(self, connection_info, instance, mountpoint): instance, mountpoint)
deleted_lines: connection_info, instance['name'], mountpoint) connection_info, instance['name'], mountpoint) def detach_volume(self, connection_info, instance_name, mountpoint): instance_name, mountpoint)

subject: bug: proxy headers aren't forwarded properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-07 16:12:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/20f10f204e3d40e2daea6c00078fe61a502b0f35', 'message': "bug: proxy headers aren't forwarded properly

The proxy currently forwards headers in WSGI format,
e.g. 'Content_Length', vs. 'Content-Length'. This breaks any standards
conforming HTTP server that's placed in between the proxy and
marconi-queues endpoints (for partitioning). This patch cannonicalizes
headers before they are forwarded to resolve this issue.

commit_message:
bug: proxy headers aren't forwarded properly

The proxy currently forwards headers in WSGI format,
e.g. 'Content_Length', vs. 'Content-Length'. This breaks any standards
conforming HTTP server that's placed in between the proxy and
marconi-queues endpoints (for partitioning). This patch cannonicalizes
headers before they are forwarded to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: I1eab83dbb1fb9cfec5d15d40830e383da4e6591e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/29/50129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def cannonicalize(headers): return dict([(k.replace('_', '-'), v) for k, v in headers.items()]) resp = requests.request(method, url, headers=cannonicalize(request._headers),

commit_message:
Host aggregate configuration throws exception

If the virtualization driver did not implement the host
aggregate support functions (add_to_aggregate,
remove_from_aggregate and undo_aggregate_operation) then an
exception is thrown when a host aggregate was created/deleted.
Configuration of the host aggregates breaks tempest tests when
the underlying driver does not have these methods implemented.

The only driver that actually uses this is the Xen driver.
The solution enables all drivers to support this without
having to add in specific code. More specifically, the compute
manager will not raise NotImplementedError.

Closes-Bug: 1229912
Closes-Bug: 1229911

Change-Id: Iee69e45d94047742b6a499a139bac96ad9dd971f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/48326/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def add_to_aggregate(self, context, aggregate, host, **kwargs): """Add a compute host to an aggregate.""" pass def remove_from_aggregate(self, context, aggregate, host, **kwargs): """Remove a compute host from an aggregate.""" pass def undo_aggregate_operation(self, context, op, aggregate, host, set_error=True): """Undo for Resource Pools.""" pass

commit_message:
Refactor for testability of an upcoming change

confirm_token_not_expired() in keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py has
been moved out of the class to make it a function and be more testable.
Currently, there is no need to keep it within the class. An upcoming
commit makes fixes that rely on this refactor to be tested.

Change-Id: I8460a2ee663dec8be0f339735208779a3b988040

added_lines: def _action(self, body): """ Perform a server "action" -- reboot/rebuild/resize/etc. """ action_id = "service" url = "/mgmt/flavors/%s/action" % action_id resp, body = self.api.client.post(url, body=body) check_for_exceptions(resp, body) def register(self, flavors): """ Creates the service mappings for flavor(s) """ body = {'register': {"flavors": flavors}} self._action(body) def deregister(self, flavors): """ Deletes the service mappings for flavor(s) """ body = {'deregister': {"flavors": flavors}} self._action(body) def get(self, service_type): """ Get flavors registered for specific services. """ return self._get("/mgmt/flavors/%s" % base.getid(service_type))

commit_message:
Make hash algorithm configurable for new rings.

While it is true that there are currently no second-preimage attacks
against MD5, there are other attacks that weaken it, and it's not like
MD5 is going to get any stronger.

Now you can give a different hash algorithm to `swift-ring-builder
create` on the command line, and all your object paths will get hashed
with the new algorithm. On-disk filenames will reflect the new hash.

You can't change an existing ring's hash algorithm. I mean, you *can*,
but you'll lose all your data.

This works by having the proxy (a) pay attention to the ring's hash
algorithm when hashing paths, and (b) extract the hash algorithm from
the rings and pass it to the backend servers via HTTP headers so they
can hash paths the same way. If the header is missing, the backends
will default to md5, so upgrades of existing clusters will work.

Note that there's a use of MD5 in Ring.get_more_nodes() that's been
left there intentionally. It doesn't affect on-disk placement, only
handoff selection, and it operates on the partition number that comes
from the configurable hash anyway. Changing that wouldn't actually
gain us anything.

Note: doesn't work on py2.6, it seems. Who knew?

Change-Id: I48eb975ac3c252294f365d19f7aaff96c507b468
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/26/49226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def generate_request_headers(self, orig_req=None, ring=None, additional=None, transfer=False): Create a list of headers to be used in backend request :param ring: the relevant ring headers.setdefault('x-hash-algorithm', ring.hash_algorithm) headers = self.generate_request_headers(req, ring, additional=req.headers)
deleted_lines: def generate_request_headers(self, orig_req=None, additional=None, transfer=False): Create a list of headers to be used in backend requets headers = self.generate_request_headers(req, additional=req.headers)

commit_message:
Change rpc_support_old_agents default to False

Changes the rpc_support_old_agents config variable default value to
False, so that the vlan_id field (redundant with the segmentation_id
field) is no longer included in RPC messages from the linuxbridge and
mlnx plugins to their corresponding L2 agents. This can be set to True
if needed to support L2 agents older than midway through the havana
cycle.

Closes-Bug: 1235323
Change-Id: I919824c5b02e28e3563e64e98bb106bf722327ec

commit_message:
Create v1 package and move messages there

The patch creates a v1 package where the client v1 API will reside. The
patch also moves messages.py out from transport/http into this new
package.

Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: Ib11eabc44c0df8867e884b4eafe65f266c6e3ef0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/64/48664/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix HTTP response for PortNotFound during boot (v3 API)

If a non-existent Neutron port is passed as a network parameter during create
instance, Nova API should return a 404 error. This was fixed for the V2
API in commit 4721408ea861a66af1ad1df5a45c42addcd8a95f (though with a 400).
This applies the corresponding fix to the V3 API.

Fixes bug 1212137

Change-Id: I27dfba636635eb8ac257785b833b240bc439f9ff

commit_message:
Return a NetworkInfo object instead of a list

This return a NetworkInfo object instead of a list when there are no
configured networks available.

Fixes bug #1222781

Change-Id: I59c88944253ed5ff8b567d79046c3065fdfed9ab

commit_message:
Update allowvssprovider in xenstore_data

My previous commit was missing the vm-data part so the original
bug was still present.

The command line fix:
xe vm-param-set uuid={UUID} xenstore-data:vm-data/allowvssprovider=false

This commit adds vm-data to the xenstore message and will properly
disallow vss.

Fixes: bug #1112673

Change-Id: I85ef25a9b61795c98c12549f77cd7ca7305861d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/45458/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'xenstore_data': {'vm-data/allowvssprovider': 'false'}}

subject: Clone volume with right size with SolidFire
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-05 00:12:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/19e92af7eff54fd75e2a91b772812da46c60b3cc', 'message': 'Clone volume with right size with SolidFire

It is possible to clone a volume with a size greater than
the source volume. When using the SolidFire driver, the volume size
was not passed in the call made to the SolidFire API when
cloning a volume.

It resulted in a cloned volume having the same size as the source
volume but the correct size in the Cinder database.

This changes makes sure the cloned volume has the correct size
by explicitly passing the requested size when calling
the SolidFire API and cloning the volume.

Fixes: bug #1219105
Change-Id: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc
(cherry picked from commit 0a87ff988cd21586daeb6ed886e44aedaa49c320)
'}]
commit_message:
Clone volume with right size with SolidFire

It is possible to clone a volume with a size greater than
the source volume. When using the SolidFire driver, the volume size
was not passed in the call made to the SolidFire API when
cloning a volume.

It resulted in a cloned volume having the same size as the source
volume but the correct size in the Cinder database.

This changes makes sure the cloned volume has the correct size
by explicitly passing the requested size when calling
the SolidFire API and cloning the volume.

Fixes: bug #1219105
Change-Id: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc
(cherry picked from commit 0a87ff988cd21586daeb6ed886e44aedaa49c320)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/43/45143/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'newSize': int(v_ref['size'] * self.GB),

commit_message:
Fix skip_because decorator

If we use skip_because decorator, the below error occurs.
 _StringException: ImportError: Failed to import test module:...
And, all tests of the class having the skip_because decorator are not
tested.
This commit fixes it.

Change-Id: I98e51d3bfd8b13dc3ef462eb92b170295f5f142e
Closes-Bug: #1236220

commit_message:
NEC plugin: Fix nec-agent unexpected exit due to RPC exception

Changes nec-agent to catch RPC exceptions in the main
daemon loop. It fixes the following two bugs.

- nec-agent dies with RPC timeout in secgroup RPC
  (Closes-Bug: #1235106)

- port_added message can be dropped when RPC timeout occurs
  (Closes-Bug: #1235111). Moves exception catch from PluginApi
  to the main daemon loop.

Change-Id: I12394b739fc35bff271543f4625c5e3152e534ae

self.get_vif_ports = mock.patch.object( ovs_lib.OVSBridge, 'get_vif_ports', return_value=vif_ports).start() self.update_ports = mock.patch.object( nec_neutron_agent.NECPluginApi, 'update_ports').start() self.prepare_devices_filter = mock.patch.object( self.agent.sg_agent, 'prepare_devices_filter').start() self.remove_devices_filter = mock.patch.object( self.agent.sg_agent, 'remove_devices_filter').start() def _test_single_loop(self, with_exc=False, need_sync=False): self.agent.cur_ports = ['id-0', 'id-1'] self.agent.need_sync = need_sync self.agent.loop_handler() if with_exc: self.assertEqual(self.agent.cur_ports, ['id-0', 'id-1']) self.assertTrue(self.agent.need_sync) else: self.assertEqual(self.agent.cur_ports, ['id-1', 'id-2']) self.assertFalse(self.agent.need_sync) def test_single_loop_normal(self): self._setup_mock() self._test_single_loop() agent_id = 'nec-q-agent.dummy-host' self.update_ports.assert_called_once_with( self.remove_devices_filter.assert_called_once_with(['id-0']) def test_single_loop_need_sync(self): self._setup_mock() self._test_single_loop(need_sync=True) agent_id = 'nec-q-agent.dummy-host'
